item.title: Episode 111 - RavenDB with Oren Eini

item.title: Faster iteration experience for AWS SAM applications in the AWS Toolkits for JetBrains and VS Code | Amazon Web Services
item.description: Today, the AWS Toolkits for JetBrains and VS Code released a faster code iteration experience for developing AWS SAM applications. The AWS Toolkits are open source plugins for JetBrains and VS Code IDEs that provide an integrated experience for developing Serverless applications, including assistance for getting started and local step-through debugging capabilities for Serverless applications. item.title: Joseph Woodward | Software Engineer &amp; Go lover based in Somerset, England
item.description: For a while now I’ve been keeping a close eye on the structure logging proposal making its way through Go’s language proposal process. Last month an experimental version of the proposal was released under the golang.org/x/exp package (see documentation here) and I decided to experiment with it and decided to summarise my learnings in a blog for others to learn more about this proposed addition to the Go standard library.

item.title: Drones to protect civilians and Communication equipment
item.description:
These funds will purchase thermal vision drones for the Ukrainian 92nd brigade. - 5 Thermal vision DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Advanced drones - 5 DJI Mavic 3 FMC drones - Motorola SLR5500 VHF repeater
The brigade protects the civilian population and liberates villages around Svatove.
We will also purchase a radio repeater for better coordination between the Ukrainian Liberators

item.title: PublishAotCompressed 1.0.0
item.description: MSBuild targets to compress outputs of PublishAot with UPX. Simply add reference to this package and publish with PublishAot as usual.

item.title: Pie-Stop for Pi-Hole | planetkris
item.description: Just setup a pi-hole for DNS filtering. I subscribed to a bunch of block lists and then subsequently prevented Christine from loading a site on her work laptop. Seeing as how the network admin is not always home to take care of issues like this, I wanted a way for anyone in the house to disable filtering for ~5 min. There are many, many, many IoT button tutorials out there, with lots of different hardware, so this post will cover light details, please use it for inspiration.
